life has been crazy these past couple of weeks!  working, partying, and moving in with heather.

a lot has been going on at work.  we got a new supervisor, tony.  he was our lead for our team and he took over the supervisor position when gil got moved to supervise the met team.  we have been struggling a lot these past 2 weeks since he has taken the position.  we are behind in almost everything.  i have been giving a lot more responsibilities...i'm in charge of 3 queues, i work the front desk, and i've been expediting a lot as well.  it can be overwhelming some days.  i'm usually stuck working 11+ hours a day.  tony is planning on hiring 2 more peeps.  we already got a new girl working with us, amanda.  i was training her saturday and today.  this week is even more sucky because the lady who works the front desk is on vacation the whole week so that means my second-hand man martin who helps me with the more important queues is stuck working the front desk most of this week, and then friday i'm up front all day.  i'm really thinking about changing my schedule to working monday through friday instead of working 4 ten hour days.  i don't know how many times i've said that.  i hate having to work saturdays now because i can't stay out late and party with my friends...

speaking of partying i've been doing that a lot these past couple of weeks.  i think it's mostly because of the fact that i was going to move in with heather and that once i did move in i wouldn't have the "privileges" anymore...that i would have to ask for permission to do things.  so i've been partying it up like a storm and doing my own thing.  gil had that house party which was so much fun!  martin and i got so fucked up that night.  i was dancing with everybody and i made out with a straight girl.  crazy!  i swear the moring-after french toast from the village inn had never tasted any better!  the next big outing that happened was the drag king show.  my friend aimee, aka "poppy chulo", is an amateur drag king.  i missed her debut so i felt like i had to go to the second showing.  i had so much fun and spent so much money on tipping the performers.  after the show we ended up staying at the club where me and my friends danced our asses off.  we always have so much fun when we go to the club.  we all dance freaky and shit.  i was dancing with my friend joe and he actually got a hard on!  i should mention that he is gay!  he was acting very strange that night...telling me not to leave him and to stay with him all night.  very weird.  then this past week i went out thursday, friday, and saturday night.  thursday martin and i went to applebees for our after work shot lol.  we met up with this guy shain from work and he kept on buying us rounds of vodka.  after applebees we headed over to the ranch.  it was my first time there, and i had a really good time.  cheap beer and pool.  it was karaoke night too, which was fun.  and then on friday me, my friend lena and her girlfriend naomi and their friend steven...we all went out to the pulse.  it was such a shitty night!  lena and steven ended up getting involved in some major drama so i spent half the night standing outside making sure no fists started flying.  lena got pissed at me because she felt like i didn't have her back...i was just trying to stay out of the whole thing because it's really none of my business to begin with.  i wished i could have just left but i had volunteered to drive so i had to stay.  so by the time we decided to leave i was really annoyed with the whole night.  when i was driving everybody home i got pulled over by a rookie cop who thought i was drunk.  i don't blame him for pulling me over because i was driving up the wrong side of the street....steven was giving me drunk directions to this apartment he was going to stay at and i ended up turning into a blocked off driveway into the complex.  i was too tired, lazy, and annoyed with everything at that point that i didn't get back to the right side of the road.  yep i just stayed on the left side of the rode and drove up to the next turn in to get into the complex.  my luck that the only car around at 2 am was a cop.  he pulled me over, treated me like shit...yelling at me that he could "smell me from a mile away".  in my head it was pretty ridiculous because i knew i was sober and nothing was going to happen other than a possible ticket.  he was so convinced i was wasted.  had to take the sobriety test and blow into breathalizer.  when i blew a 0 he let me go without even a ticket and told me to drive on the right side of the road next time.  to be honest i was scared as hell and it was an experience, and i won't ever drive after drinking because of it.  at least the cop was a rookie and didn't realize that my eyes were dilated.  anyway, i didn't get home that night until 3 or so.  i ended up just falling asleep in my clothes.  i was dragging the next day at work.  then that night aimee and anna had a party.  i swear i only had planned on staying for only 2 hours because i was tired as shit from getting 3 hours of sleep the previous night.  it ended up being a really crazy night too.  i will say though that some gay boys are the strangest people.  steven wanted me, this guy josh started sucking on my neck, and this gay couple said that if i was a boy they would want to take me home.  i think it must be my hair.  martin tried to explain it to me, and he said that it's because i look like a boy.  i don't understand lol!  at least the lesbians that were there wanted me too lol!  aimee told me that she had requests from some of the girls to find out who i was and to let me know that i was "fucking hot".  anna told me that i could use the upstairs room that was empty, and in the end i did.  it was a crazy, crazy night.  i really need to stop hanging out with these people, even though they are fun as hell.  they really are a bad influence on me.  

that's about it for now.  i'm gonna head back home and let heather's dog out to pee.  maybe tonight she will want to have sex lol.  

peace out.

myspace can suck a big one! :p anyway...long day today. i'm surprised i actually made it through. i didn't sleep very well last night because everytime i woke up to roll over i felt so nauseous. it started yesterday late afternoon when i left heather's to go to work for a few hours. i almost lost my lunch at work i few times, but i was able to hold it down. i stayed at work until 9:45 or so knocking out the referrals in my queue. got home in one piece...because when i'm sick all i want to do is sleep, and i was afraid of falling asleep in the car. i got home and just crashed. this morning i woke up and i thought i was feeling better until i was about to leave to go to work. i was so sick!! after this morning i'm never going to purchase the chicken enchiladas with red at duran's ever again!! after all of that i was still able to get my ass to work and work 10 hours. i worked ever single one of my days off this week. 5 hours on sunday, 5 hours monday, and 4 hours on tuesday. today i worked 10 and tomorrow i will work 10. it's worth it because i have friday and saturday off (pto of 20 hours!!!) so i should be getting some $$$ for this week boy!! yesterday i had an eye appointment. picked out some cute frames for my new glasses and picked up new contacts. apparently my new eye insurance doesn't cover contacts because i had to cough up 73 bucks for 2 boxes. heather said that she would pay for my glasses because, well, it was her dog that destroyed my old pair. i can't wait until my glasses are ready. i'm tired of having to wear my contacts all the effing time. my check is a little weak this payday...mostly because i didn't have my badge with me this past saturday so i didn't get the hours in for that day. those hours will show up on my next pay check. i still have enough to give a chunk to my credit card company though, which is all that i care about right now lol. look at what heather and i are gonna buy friday morning before we head out to the gila. we saw it at the sportsman's warehouse: The latest evolution in powerful and portable heat is here! BIG Buddy from Enerco/Mr. Heater now takes portable heat to another level --- 18,000 BTU/HR with the capacity to heat up to 400 square feet of space for up to 220 hours. camping is going to rock. i'm so excited. :D i need to go to my bank and complain because i ordered checks about 3 weeks ago and they haven't arrived. i used the last one when i went to finalize things with gilbert (my car insurance agent) monday. i'll be damned if i have to pay for another stupid order! good news! gil moved his house warming party to next saturday!!!! alright i'm done. peace out.

i was late to work today.  i woke up suddenly this morning and checked my watch.  i was horrified to see that it was 7:05.  i don't think i ever got dressed so fast in my entire life.  i realized halfway to work, doing 90 on the freeway, that i left all my crap at heather's house...my cell phone, my work badge, my license.  i was only rushing because i was 4 hours late on friday as well...

i am glad that i have such an awesome supervisor.  i emailed him this morning that i was late again, he said not to worry and that "sh_t happens" lol.  he said that he has my back and he won't let anything happen in terms of me losing my job.  that's awesome!  he said that he loves my work ethic and my personality, and told me not to worry.  i love gil!  it's a shame that i can't make his house warming party this coming saturday.  i would love to go!  i told him he should have let me know what was going down before i made plans to go camping.  

thursday night heather and i headed over to amc.  she was able to get the next day off because of an appointment, so we went out.  she got so drunk lol.  i know she's drunk when she gets on top of the boxes and dances her ass off lol.  we ended up meeting heather's under-aged friend ashley there, and heather was able to get her into the club.  my honey really knows the tricks of the trade.  i really think we are corrupting ashely lol!  it was her first time in a gay club, and it was a bit of a shock because there are all types of gay folk that hang out there.  after the club we went to denny's where every other gay drunk person and their friends ended up going as well.  it was really strange.  anyway, afterwards i dropped ashley off back at the club so she could get her car and head home.  then heather and i headed home.  we didn't get to bed until about 5 am.  that's really the reason i didn't go to work at 7.  i slept in until 10.  good times...

i think my clothes are dry now.  i need to put them away and head back over to heather's house.  i'm so sleepy!  

i need to work tomorrow for 5 hours and then we are going to start getting the camping stuff ready.  later on tomorrow heather and i will meet up with a couple of my friends from work at laffs for the 8 pm show.  and then anna and aime are having an l word party tomorrow night.  such a full day!

i'm so going to go running tomorrow morning and going to the gym in the afternoon.  i've been feeling so gross lately.  it must be because of my period.

it's official.  i finally have a car of my own!  yesterday i bought a 2001 nissan x-terra!  it's my baby!!!! it's white and all pretty looking!  it's a standard!  payments are only $287/month, which isn't bad at all, and it's including warranty.  insurance is a little high, but that will go down within 6 months.  it's so awesome!  it's so me!!  everyone at work was very impressed with it hehehe!  heather and i are gonna try it out next weekend when we go camping down at the gila.  we are both very excited! :D

i have a couple of things i still need to take care of.  i need to make an appt with my mechanic to have him check out a couple of things before the 60 day initial warranty is up.  i need to get together with my insurance agent to finalize things as well.  

i feel so independent!  it's fucking awesome!  i didn't need a co-signer or anything.  i feel so great...

:D

i had a horrible day at work today!  i had patients yelling at me, pharmacists yelling at me.  i had to deal with stupid insurance companies even though i've never been trained in eligibility.  and to top it all of i got a verbal warning for....taking short lunches!  i wasn't even aware that i was taking short lunches.  apparently i have been clocking in 3 and 4 minutes earlier than i'm allowed to.  i wasn't even aware of it, and i'm so not doing it on purpose.  lately i've been so focused on all the work i have to do that i don't even pay attention to the times when i clock in and clock out.  fucking shit man!  

you know what i think?  i think that because i made so much more money during the last pay period they are now checking my time sheets and analyzing every little clock in and clock out.  i bet you that is what is happening!  i know for a fact that they are hating that techs are making a lot of money due to ot and whatnot.  i can totally see them cracking down on things, and the little slips that people are making are being shoved into their faces.  so fucked up!  

damn.  i can't believe that today i completely hated my place of work.  after i was verbally warned i was fuming man!  i was so ready to quit right then and there.  here is what i have to say about the whole thing:  i think that management has to take the broom stick out of the ass and get a grip.  they are only making shit worse and adding to everyone's stress level.  i think that tempe should have to deal with their own exceptions referrals instead of giving them all to my department.  it's like all they freakin do in arizona is sit on their ass because they give us (abq) all their issues!  and finally i think that gaye lynn can just go to hell...fucking grumpy old witch. 

i'm fed up with it.  i'm thinking about applying to cardinal health where i can be doing basically the same shit and be paid more.  and it's just across the street!  how conveeeenient.....  

ugh, anyway.  today one of my childhood friend's, amanda, came in when i was working the front desk this morning.  she's all married now and her hubby is on active duty with the military.  she actually use to work at express scripts, in the back end to be exact.  kinda cool.  

that's about it.  i'm gonna go to sleep and hope that tomorrow will be a better day.  that is actually something i have doubts about already because it's friday and fridays always suck a big one at work.

i took a nice long 3 day weekend.  saturday night i went out to a pizza party for lena's daughter and her cousin.  anna and amy were there along with lena's girlfriend naomi.  even joe and his boyfriend charles were there.  joe has been martin's fuck buddy for about 2 weeks now.  it's so crazy!!  hehehe...so i decided to eat free pizza and salad instead of going over to my supervisor's ufc party since it was closer to my house.  i didn't want to drive all the way across town.  it will be better once he moves to this side of town.  anyway, after the pizza party we all went to the club.  i didn't tell heather that i was gonna go out to the club because she would just annoy me about how she wouldn't be around.  she still doesn't know i went out.  i had so much fun dude!  heather would be proud of me...i didn't hook up with anyone, or dance with anyone, or really even look at anyone lol.  i just drank and danced with my own groovy self haha.  i got so drunk though.  i drank so much that when i got home later i was so sick!  i was vomiting on the hour, every hour.  i told heather that it was food poisoning from the ghetto pizza i had eaten.  it was horrible.  i had to call out of work sunday.  there was no way i could work my voluntary 5 hours.  horrible.  and i so owe my honey a hotel weekend.  she had to cancel our 2 month anniversary hotel getaway cos i was too sick.  i still feel really bad about it...i can't bring myself to tell her the real reason i was sick.  

i still haven't fully recovered from being sick.  i can only eat one meal a day, and after i eat i get a little nauseous.  i can't help it!  even the thought of alcohol makes me a little queazy too.  so i don't think i will be drinking friday at the comedy club.  i won free tickets to the 8 pm show (again), and everyone from work is coming.  martin, lena and her girlfriend and their 5 gay friends, kimberly, caroline, maybe even loriann.  today i had to ask caroline if she doesn't mind if she hangs out with a bunch of gay people friday night.  she will most likely be the only straight person there lol. 

i so landed a hefty check for this coming payday.  $921.86!!!!!!!  i worked a total of 104.25 hours.  26.75 hours of ot and 4 hours of double time really kicked in this time.  i will be able to pay most of my credit card bill and get an mp3 player.  excellent!!  :D

ok gonna go workout then grab a shower.

i only worked 3 hours today.  i left early because i just could not function with this stupid headcold that i acquired over the last 48 hours.  i had felt it coming on wednesday.  stupid me went out to laffs to watch some stand up comedy that night with a couple of friends instead of going home and getting some rest.  oh well.  anyway, i can only hope that the higher ups at work will realize that i already completed my 6 hours of mandatory ot for this week won't dock me an entire point for leaving early today.  i already talked to my supervisor about saturday's mandatory ot, and he said that it would be ok that i did it on sunday.  so i have to work 10 hours saturday and at least 8 hours on sunday.  then i have to make up today's hours on monday and tuesday.  it sucks that i won't even get a day off.  i really can't complain though, because they are offering double time for any extra hours put in once we've hit 50 for the week...

i'm actually feeling a whole lot better than earlier.  after i left work i hit the bank to deposit my check then i headed over to heather's where i slept for a couple of hours.  i left her place and went to walgreens where i picked up this airborne stuff that my friend kimberly suggested i take.  it's kinda like alka-seltzer...these tablets that you put in water and they dissolve.  so i put a tab in a bottle of water about an hour and a half ago, and i feel amazingly better already.  after walgreens i went across the street to best buy where i picked up britney spears' greatest hits.  hehe heather it so gonna kill me! lol

speaking of which, my honey has really surprised me lately, both good and bad.  she surprised me last sunday with tickets to go see lifehouse.  she also bought me their new cd which allowed me to meet the band as well.  that was great.  on the downside, last night she finally whipped out the "i love you".  really surprised me, and of course i said it back.  i need to have a little talk with her because i know i'm not on the same level with her.  not quite. it takes me more than a month to figure out if i love somebody, and i don't want to just say that i do if i don't mean it, you know?  i really like her, but i'm not in love.  not yet.  especially since lately i've had very serious doubts about us.           

tommorow night (if i feel better that is) i'm hitting the clubs with kimberly and martin.  gonna go to exhale first and then head to the pulse.  i think we might cab it.  i so cannot wait!  martin and kim are so fucking fun to hang out with.  i still have to tell heather though.  she's been so up in my grill lately that i really don't want to let her know what i'm doing tomorrow night.  she's been checking my texts on my phone, and wanting to know about every single phone conversation that i have.  if i was doing something to hurt her i would understand, but i'm not doing a damn thing!  i really don't know what her problem is.  she gets really annoyed with me when i don't let her read my texts.  i mean she dislikes all my friends anyway, so i feel that she really doesn't need to know what we talk about or what we do unless i deem it necessary that she knows.

that's about it for now i suppose.  i need to go throw my clothes in the dryer and head back over to heather's.  i left my damn cell phone there.

MY CELL PHONE BILL IS $232.35!!!!!!!!!!!!

i'm already over my usage for the current billing period.  i need to go to a verizon store asap and change plans or add more minutes or something!!! 


CRAP!!

i've been so busy lately i haven't had time to use the computer very much.  work has been my main thing.  this week i've been having to work 12 hour shifts.  i was put up at the front desk this week (our only retail-like part of the pharmacy).  it's alright i guess, at least now anyway.  at first i was very uncomfortable with it because i had no fucking clue what i was doing, and all i was doing was annoying people when i couldn't do certain things for them or answer their questions.  that's the kind of training we get at express scripts though....hardly none at all.  i swear it's like a slave drive!  i was denied my vacation time in february, and they are denying people's days off.  it's crazy!  if they keep it up people will be quitting left and right.  there are some peeps who have had to take a week off from work or longer because they keep on getting sick.  luckily i've had better luck then some.   

[rant]
fuck me!  the madre just told me that the mother fucking dog ate my new adidas baseball cap.  fucking shit!  that really pisses me the fuck off!  i wish he would just run away already.  fucking fucker of a mutt!!!!!!!!!!!  that little bastard is nothing but trouble.  now i'm going to have to charge a new one.
[/rant]

i have to scan some pictures onto the puter that i took while at the zoo with heather last sunday.  i took some really awesome pics man!  i'll have to put them up on here when i get the chance.  

last saturday i went to bowling with a bunch of people from work.  i love hanging out with my friends from work.  everyone is just so cool.  bowling was fun.  everyone bought me drinks.  i had a great time.  everyone knows i'm gay and that i have a girlfriend, and everybody is cool with it.  today my supervisor, gil, invited me over to his place tonight for a board game party he was having.  i would love to have gone but i'm just way too tired.  plus i have to work 10 hours tomorrow.

i started a diet a few days ago.  2 days in and still going strong! :)

alright time to scan those pics.

my new year's eve went down like a ton of bricks.  the plan was to hit tamon's (heather's friend) party and then possibly head over to my friend lena and her girlfriend's little get together.  heather called me early in the afternoon to let me know she was feeling really sick and that she was having an allergic reaction to something.  yeah, fucking great right?  yeah pretty typical.  anyway, i ended up purchasing a ridiculous amount of alcohol for the parties and most of it is still either in the fridge or the freezer at heather's house.  we brought the beer over to tamon's party.  we left within 10 seconds of arriving, along with my beer.  i wasn't going to let all those gangster stoners have any of my alcohol.  after having left tamon's lit up party, i called lena and asked where she lived.  turned out she lives practically in timbuktu, and i didn't want to drive all the way across town for a lesbian "get together".  i wanted to fucking party man.  we ended up going to the pulse where i spent $30 for both of us to get in.  by that time heather was feeling really shitty, and i just wanted to get really fucked up.  i bought us both drinks and i ended up drinking them both.  i knew heather was really not feeling well when she couldn't finish a damn beer.  i was a tad bit annoyed the whole time we were there because all heather felt like doing was sitting down or standing in one place.  her muscles were achy and shit, so she was not up to getting all freaky on the dance floor with me.  i had spent all this money and all we basically did was sit around.  i tried my best to have a good time, and that pretty much meant just getting fucked up.  when i was buying my first "sex on the beach" i was hit on hard by this really cute girl.  all i can remember is that i really wanted to hookup with her.  but alas, i didn't, since my girlfriend was sitting on one of the couches waiting for me to return.  as a matter of fact i did a lot of "checking out the girl's" kind of thing.  i was quite unhappy being with my girlfriend last night.  we ended up leaving before midnight and spent new year's in a walmart, buying bagel bites for my drunk ass.

today i drove heather to the urgent care center, paid for her copay, bought breakfast for us both, drove her to the grocery store, paid for her juice, 7up, soup (ya know, the basic "i'm sick with the flu" groceries), spent my entire day with her, calling on her every beckoning need, and all she did was whine and moan that she wasn't feeling well and point out to me that i didn't even care.  i can't believe i missed out on bowling with my friends from work for all that.    

plus we haven't had sex yet and her views on mentally disabled individuals disturbs me. 

so yeah, i'm not so sure anymore.

it's been a while since i last updated.  things have been well for the most part.  finished up the semester this wednesday with my final.  i'm expecting at least a b in ochem, and i ended up getting an 86 in my lab.  not bad.  i've been busy with work as well, which has been extremely frustrating for the most part.  lately i've been feeling very inadequate for the position i've been given.  it seems like i really don't know enough about how a pharmacy works to be working in expedite.  and to top it all off my supervisor has me training two people.  that sucks because i'm not 100% sure of what i'm doing most of the time, and i don't want to train the newbies wrong, ya know?  sucky!   

i'm gonna have to pick this up later...

ugh!  i have to redo my fave places list for aohell.  we had 9.0 optimized installed on the puter.  i have lost eveything!  so annoying.  i can't function on the internet without a favorite places folder lol.  

ooooh!  we got the dsl hookup yesterday.  we get it installed this week!

i've been so busy lately!!  i finished met (multiple exceptions team) training friday.  we had a pizza partay to celebrate.  on monday/tuesday, kim, tony, and myself are going to start mrt (member response team) training.  we started the puter programs training associated with that job on thursday.  pain in the ass man!  i wonder if that means i will get more money though.  i did get paid on friday.  not as much as i thought i was going to get for a first paycheck, but it will do.   

yahoo.com is being a futher mucker!!!  what the hell?!?!  this is the right password!!  i've been using it for the past 5 years!

holy shit! my brother has to have a serious attitude adjustment.  the dogs are barking like maniacs and they woke him up.  he just went outside and started yelling at them.  i think his metal music gets to his head sometimes :\

so i met this girl heather.  she hit me up on that yahoo personals site and we've been chatting for a few days now.  she is 25 and very cool.  she really isn't the person i had pictured her being at all.  we met up and had a very early dinner yesterday at gardunos.  that place has some seriously good food.  mmmmm.  then i had to jet home to give my bro the car.  he had a concert to go to at 7.  i wish he would have let me known sooner!!! :p  heather picked me up a little later and we went to sidelines to shoot pool and watch football.  we had 2 pitchers of beer and shared fried mushrooms and mozzy sticks.  we left after these ghetto guys came in and took a seat right near us.  it was a little uncomfortable.  then we headed over to exhale around 11.  i don't understand how that place works.  i go there alone and no one hits on me, but i go there with someone and everyone hits on me!  lesbians are weird!!!!  we met up with heather's friend beverly.  she was so drunk and so funny haha!  we played a few games of pool and air hockey and danced a little and had more to drink.  good times.  i won't see heather again until the middle of this week.  she works the next 3 nights.  her police car rocks!  i told her i want to ride in it one of these days lol.  the three of us (bev, myself, heather) are going to the pulse next weekend.  i love the pulse!  :D

i registered for classes the other day.  planning on taking quantitative analysis with a lab and cell biology with the discussion group.  i would have class tuesdays and thursdays.  on tuesdays i would be in school all day.  first lecture is at 9:30 and i would end it with the 4 hour lab and the discussion group, getting out of school at 8:15 at night.  thursdays i would just have the 2 lecture classes in the morning.  i think my problem is that i don't know what my work schedule is going to be.  i know that i will have to work 10 hour days on monday, wednesday, friday, and saturday.  i really don't want to work a 10 hour day on saturday, but i don't know if i would be allowed to put hours in on thursday.  it's just too complicated!  i most likely will end up taking the quant with the lab and save the bio for the summer, which i really don't want to do.  it's all too complicated.  geeez i don't know how i'm going to do school and work full time!

alright well i need to shower.  i smell like cigarette smoke.  then i have laundry to do.

<i>KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) -- Unlike most college students nearing 
graduation, Clarissa Hall isn't worried about finding a job - she's 
already considering several offers, including some with possible 
starting salaries of at least $80,000. Hall is benefiting from a 
nationwide shortage of pharmacists, which has prompted fierce 
competition between employers for new pharmacy graduates.

"Pretty much everyone in my class has people calling them left and 
right about jobs," said Hall, a University of Missouri-Kansas City 
student from Poplar Bluff. "I've had several people calling me and I 
don't even graduate until May."

The shortage of pharmacists, though, is not good for others in the 
medical field, or their patients, say those who have been watching 
the shortage worsen over the last decade.

It was fueled by several factors, especially changes in insurance 
policies and federal regulations of pharmaceuticals, which made drugs 
available to more people.

Add to that an aging population and more drugs being manufactured and 
advertised to the public, and the number of prescriptions has 
increased from 2 billion to 3.2 billion in the last decade. That 
problem is expected to worsen after the new Medicare prescription 
drug program begins Jan. 1, pharmacy officials said.

Independent and chain pharmacies, hospitals and nursing homes are 
scrambling to find people to fill orders.

The National Association of Chain Drug Stores reported about 5,950 
full- and part-time openings in July in its 37,000 member stores. The 
American Hospital Association reported a 7.4 percent vacancy rate for 
pharmacists as of December, 2004, with 38 percent of its members 
saying it was harder to recruit pharmacists last year than in 2003.

The National Community Pharmacists Association, which represents 
independent pharmacies, does not keep track of job openings.

A consortium of pharmacy groups called the Pharmacy Manpower Project 
issued a report in 2002 predicting 157,000 unfilled pharmacy openings 
by 2020.

The need to fill all those new prescriptions has been partially 
addressed by an increase in technology and the use of pharmacy 
technicians, said Dr. David Knapp, dean of the School of Pharmacy at 
the University of Maryland.

But that hasn't addressed increasing pressure on pharmacists to 
become more involved in helping patients manage their drugs, 
especially elderly patients who may take several medicines, said 
Knapp, who coordinated the conference that released the Manpower 
report.

"Every hour of every day, dozens if not hundreds of prescriptions are 
coming across the counter," he said. "They are trying to do that 
while at the same time counseling patients, calling physicians, 
helping diabetic patients manage eight or 10 medicines, teaching 
parents how to help their child use his new asthma inhaler. It's a 
real stressed out situation for pharmacists."

Around the country, universities are opening new pharmacy schools or 
expanding existing programs, but it likely will take years for supply 
to meet demand. Some schools have reported 10 applicants for every 
pharmacy opening, although that figure includes people applying to 
more than one school, Maine said.

"It is a great job market for those who get in," Maine said. "But we 
also have a lot of disappointed people who are being turned away."

Many universities have opened satellite programs, and about 20 new 
pharmacy schools have opened in the last five years, Knapp said. That 
should increase the number of graduating pharmacists to more than 
10,000 in 2007, compared to about 8,000 graduates in 2003-04, Maine 
said.

"There is such an astonishing interest," said Lucinda L. Maine, 
executive vice president of the American Association of Colleges of 
Pharmacy in Alexandria, Va. "It's the highest level I've seen in my 
30 years in pharmacy admissions."

But even new schools and expansions will not help in the short-term, 
which raises concerns about whether patients will get the information 
they need about their medications, said Robert Piepho, dean of the 
Missouri-Kansas City pharmacy school.

"If patients don't have access (to pharmacists), they run the risk of 
adverse effects from drug interactions."
